item.title: Karen add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Always do what you are afraid to do." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Karen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Karen add a quote by Eiji Yoshikawa
item.description: "It was only leaves and branches." -- Eiji Yoshikawa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Peter Matthiessen
item.description: "Soon the childâ€™s clear eye is clouded over by ideas and opinions, preconceptions, and abstractions. Simple free being becomes encrusted with the burdensome armor of the ego. Not until years later does an instinct come that a vital sense of mystery has been withdrawn. The sun glints through the pines and the heart is pierced in a moment of beauty and strange pain, like a memory of paradise. After that day, we become seekers." -- Peter Matthiessen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.' No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster." -- Dalai Lama XIV
